missions.title: Taste Battle
missions.description: Pick 3 products or designs. For each, write exactly what's good, what's garbage, and why. No hedging, no 'it depends.'
missions.successCriteria: 3 sharp written opinions with specific reasoning

missions.title: No Hedge Day
missions.description: Go an entire conversation (15+ min) without hedging, qualifying, or backpedaling once. Zero 'I think maybe' energy.
missions.successCriteria: One full conversation with zero qualifications

missions.title: The Declaration
missions.description: State a strong opinion to someone — about their work, a product, a decision — and hold it when pushback comes. Don't soften.
missions.successCriteria: Stated opinion + held through pushback

missions.title: Stop Explaining
missions.description: State 3 things today and walk away without justifying. No 'because' unless they ask. Even then, keep it to one sentence.
missions.successCriteria: 3 unjustified statements delivered and held

missions.title: Small Impossible
missions.description: Find one thing someone says can't be done (too expensive, too fast, not possible) and do it. Even small scale counts.
missions.successCriteria: Delivered something someone said was impossible

missions.title: Narrative Pitch
missions.description: Tell someone about what you're building in a way that's more compelling than current reality. Pull the future into the present through your words.
missions.successCriteria: Pitched narrative to someone, they were visibly engaged

missions.title: Standard Setter
missions.description: Visibly raise the standard on one piece of work that others would have accepted as 'good enough.' Hold the higher bar.
missions.successCriteria: Raised standard, held it, delivered at the higher level

missions.title: Confrontation Study
missions.description: Watch one Jobs/Kanye/Kobe confrontation clip. Identify 3 specific techniques — how they hold frame, use silence, deploy certainty.
missions.successCriteria: 3 written technique observations from a studied clip

missions.title: Frame the Room
missions.description: Walk into a meeting or conversation and set the terms before anyone else does. Define what's being discussed, what the options are.
missions.successCriteria: Set the frame in one group interaction

missions.title: Conviction Under Fire
missions.description: Hold a strong position for a full day while multiple people push back. Zero softening, zero 'you might be right' unless they actually are.
missions.successCriteria: Held position through multiple pushbacks in one day

missions.title: Reality Bend
missions.description: Make something happen that required changing someone's belief about what's possible. Ship something they said couldn't be done.
missions.successCriteria: Changed someone's belief about what's possible through action

missions.title: 7-Day Flinch Kill
missions.description: Track flinches for 7 consecutive days, reducing the count each day. Day 7 must be lower than Day 1.
missions.successCriteria: 7-day flinch log with declining count

missions.title: Public Declaration
missions.description: Make a public statement about what you're building — post, video, pitch — with zero hedging. Put your conviction on record.
missions.successCriteria: Public statement published with zero qualifications

missions.title: Unreasonable Standard
missions.description: Set a standard so high that someone questions whether it's realistic. Then deliver on it. Prove unreasonable is just unexplored.
missions.successCriteria: Set 'unreasonable' standard + delivered

missions.title: The Impossible Ship
missions.description: Deliver something in a timeline everyone said was impossible, at a quality that silences doubt. This is the ultimate RDF move.
missions.successCriteria: Delivered the 'impossible' at undeniable quality

missions.title: The Pause
missions.description: Let 5 silences exist in conversations today without filling them. Count to 3 in your head after you speak. Let them sit.
missions.successCriteria: 5 unfilled silences across conversations

missions.title: Send It Back
missions.description: Send food back at a restaurant, return a product, or negotiate a price down. One concrete confrontation rep today.
missions.successCriteria: One completed confrontation rep

missions.title: The Mirror
missions.description: After 3 conversations today, journal every adjustment you made to match the other person — voice, energy, opinion, posture, language.
missions.successCriteria: 3 post-conversation mirror journals written

missions.title: Disagree Once
missions.description: Say 'I disagree' clearly in one conversation today. Then hold eye contact and wait 5 seconds of silence before continuing.
missions.successCriteria: One clear disagreement stated + 5-second silence held

missions.title: Status Walk
missions.description: Walk into 2 rooms today and don't adjust your energy to match. Keep your pace, your volume, your posture. Let the room adjust to you.
missions.successCriteria: Entered 2 rooms without energy adjustment

missions.title: Frame Spotter
missions.description: Identify and journal 5 frames being used on you today — in ads, conversations, news, negotiations. Name the frame and who benefits.
missions.successCriteria: 5 frames identified and journaled with analysis

missions.title: Tension Sit
missions.description: Deliberately create social tension and sit in it for 30+ seconds without resolving. Don't smooth it. Don't joke. Just be in it.
missions.successCriteria: 30+ seconds of unresolved social tension

missions.title: Emotional Boundary
missions.description: When someone is upset at you today, notice the pull to fix, apologize, or change position. Don't act on it. Stay still.
missions.successCriteria: Maintained position under emotional pressure without caving

missions.title: Preemptive Frame
missions.description: Before one important interaction today, decide the frame in advance. Set it before the other person can. 'Steal the thunder.'
missions.successCriteria: Pre-set the frame in one interaction

missions.title: The Reframe
missions.description: When someone frames you negatively today, reject their frame and replace it with one where your position is obvious. Live, not on paper.
missions.successCriteria: Reframed a negative frame in live conversation

missions.title: Frame Battle
missions.description: In a negotiation or argument, set the terms and hold them for the entire conversation. Don't let the frame shift once.
missions.successCriteria: Held frame for an entire negotiation/argument

missions.title: Stillness Week
missions.description: Practice 3+ second delayed responses in every meaningful conversation for 7 consecutive days. Break every stimulus-response chain.
missions.successCriteria: 7-day delayed response streak

missions.title: High-Stakes Hold
missions.description: In a high-stakes conversation — money, career, relationship — hold your frame completely. No flinch, no cave, no performance.
missions.successCriteria: Frame held in a genuinely high-stakes conversation

missions.title: Frame Teaching
missions.description: Teach someone else to recognize a frame being used on them. Help them see the invisible architecture of the conversation.
missions.successCriteria: Taught frame recognition to another person

missions.title: The Unshakeable Room
missions.description: Lead a meeting or group interaction where you set every frame, handle every challenge, and the room calibrates to you. Not with volume — with stillness.
missions.successCriteria: Led an interaction where the room fully calibrated to your frame

missions.title: Ask for the Discount
missions.description: Ask for a discount or upgrade at 3 businesses today. Coffee shop, store, restaurant. The answer doesn't matter — the ask does.
missions.successCriteria: 3 discount/upgrade requests made

missions.title: The Volunteer
missions.description: Be the first to volunteer for something uncomfortable today. Don't wait for someone else. Your hand goes up first.
missions.successCriteria: First to volunteer for one uncomfortable thing

missions.title: Cold Approach
missions.description: Start a conversation with a stranger about something real. Not small talk — something with substance.
missions.successCriteria: One real conversation initiated with a stranger

missions.title: Speed Decision
missions.description: Make 3 decisions today with a 60-second hard timer and incomplete information. Start the timer, decide, move. Don't revisit.
missions.successCriteria: 3 timed decisions made and executed

missions.title: Wrong in Public
missions.description: Share an opinion publicly that you might be wrong about. Post, say, or send something where being wrong is visible.
missions.successCriteria: One publicly stated opinion with real risk of being wrong

missions.title: The Uncomfortable Conversation
missions.description: Have one conversation you've been actively avoiding. The one you keep pushing to 'later.' Have it today.
missions.successCriteria: Had the avoided conversation

missions.title: Rejection Sprint
missions.description: Collect 5 rejections in one day. Ask for unreasonable things — upgrades, discounts, favors, opportunities. Stack the no's.
missions.successCriteria: 5 rejections collected in one day

missions.title: Ship Before Ready
missions.description: Launch, share, or send something before you feel it's ready. The discomfort of shipping rough is the point.
missions.successCriteria: Shipped something before feeling ready

missions.title: Physical Fear
missions.description: Do one physically uncomfortable or scary thing today. Cold water immersion, height exposure, a combat round. Physical and social fear share the same hardware.
missions.successCriteria: Completed one physically challenging fear rep

missions.title: Top of the List
missions.description: Do the scariest item currently on your fear inventory. Not the bottom — the top. The one that makes your stomach drop.
missions.successCriteria: Completed the #1 item on fear inventory

missions.title: Zero Status Day
missions.description: Spend an entire day in a new environment where you have zero status, zero credentials, zero reputation. Operate from nothing.
missions.successCriteria: Full day in an environment with zero established status

missions.title: Failure Quota
missions.description: Set a minimum of 3 failures today and hit it. Zero failures means you played too safe. Failures are proof of action.
missions.successCriteria: 3+ genuine failures from genuine attempts

missions.title: Real Stakes
missions.description: Take an action with genuine financial, social, or career consequences that scares you. Not simulated risk — real risk with real downside.
missions.successCriteria: Acted despite real consequences

missions.title: Courage for Others
missions.description: Do something frightening in service of someone else. Speak up for them, defend them, put yourself on the line for their benefit.
missions.successCriteria: Courageous action in service of another person

missions.title: The Full Send
missions.description: Execute on the biggest, scariest opportunity you've been sitting on. The one you've been 'waiting for the right time.' The right time is now.
missions.successCriteria: Executed on the biggest opportunity you've been avoiding

missions.title: The Furnace Entry
missions.description: Write 500+ words of raw, unfiltered truth about what disgusts you — mediocrity, sleepwalking, settling. This is your furnace document. Feed it.
missions.successCriteria: 500+ word furnace document entry written

missions.title: Stop Tolerating One Thing
missions.description: Identify something you've been accepting as 'fine' and refuse it today. Not tomorrow. The tolerance dies today.
missions.successCriteria: One tolerance eliminated with concrete action

missions.title: Channel the Hit
missions.description: Next time a negative emotion hits — frustration, anger, humiliation — pour it into productive work within 60 seconds. Not later. Now.
missions.successCriteria: Converted negative emotion to productive work within 60 seconds

missions.title: Raise One Bar
missions.description: Take one piece of work and raise the standard uncomfortably high. Beyond what's expected. Beyond what's reasonable. Then deliver.
missions.successCriteria: Raised and met an uncomfortably high standard

missions.title: Keep the Receipts
missions.description: Write down one slight, doubt, or dismissal and transform it into fuel. Not victimhood — 'watch me' energy. Add it to the list.
missions.successCriteria: One receipt logged and converted to fuel

missions.title: Remove the Hedge
missions.description: Identify one area of your life where you're hedging — keeping a backup plan, a safety net, a plan B — and remove it deliberately.
missions.successCriteria: One safety net removed

missions.title: Contagious Standard
missions.description: Raise a standard in a group context where others have to rise to meet it. Make mediocrity feel shameful by proximity to your standard.
missions.successCriteria: Raised group standard, others had to match

missions.title: Physical Furnace
missions.description: Train until you access actual aggression. Not discomfort — aggression. Last rep when muscles are screaming, last round when lungs are burning.
missions.successCriteria: Training session where genuine aggression was accessed

missions.title: The Refusal
missions.description: Refuse something you'd normally tolerate because 'it's fine.' It's not fine. You just trained yourself to accept it. Un-accept it.
missions.successCriteria: Actively refused something previously tolerated

missions.title: Burn the Net
missions.description: Remove one genuine safety net that's keeping you comfortable. A fallback plan, a backup option, an escape route. Close the exit.
missions.successCriteria: Genuine safety net removed, exit closed

missions.title: Full Intensity Day
missions.description: Operate at maximum intensity for an entire work day. Zero coasting, zero autopilot, zero 'I'll do it properly later.' Every hour at full burn.
missions.successCriteria: Full work day at maximum intensity, no coasting

missions.title: Furnace Review
missions.description: Return to your furnace document. Add new material. Read it all. Then use the fire to fuel one concrete, visible action today.
missions.successCriteria: Furnace document expanded + one fire-fueled action taken

missions.title: All In
missions.description: Make one commitment that closes an exit and makes retreat impossible. Burn the boat. Move forward or drown — there is no back.
missions.successCriteria: Irreversible commitment made, exit closed

missions.title: Visible Intensity
missions.description: Be so intense about something that others either rise to match or visibly can't keep up. Your fire should be the ambient temperature.
missions.successCriteria: Intensity visibly affected others' performance level

missions.title: The Unleashed Day
missions.description: Operate the entire day without any governor. Full intensity, zero mask, zero hedge, zero dimming. The version of you that has nothing to protect.
missions.successCriteria: Full day with zero governor, zero mask

missions.title: Release the Grip
missions.description: Do one thing today and consciously release all attachment to the outcome the moment you finish. Investment in the act, zero grip on the result.
missions.successCriteria: One action taken with conscious outcome release

missions.title: The Unfiltered Drop
missions.description: Say something you'd normally polish, soften, or run through 3 mental filters. Let it land raw.
missions.successCriteria: One unfiltered statement delivered

missions.title: Laugh at the L
missions.description: Make a mistake today and make it funny instead of serious. Turn the cringe into comedy. Own it publicly.
missions.successCriteria: Turned one mistake into humor publicly

missions.title: Opinion Fast
missions.description: For 2 hours today, completely stop monitoring what people think of you. Zero perception management. Just exist.
missions.successCriteria: 2 hours without checking/managing perception

missions.title: Skip the Save
missions.description: Let one thing fail that you'd normally rescue. Watch what happens without intervening. Let the consequences happen.
missions.successCriteria: Let one thing fail without rescue

missions.title: The Weird Move
missions.description: Do something deliberately weird or off-script in a social situation. Not for attention — because you felt like it and didn't filter.
missions.successCriteria: One off-script social move executed

missions.title: Wrong and Fine
missions.description: Be publicly wrong about something and move on within 5 seconds. No explanation, no correction tour, no replaying. Wrong. Shrug. Next.
missions.successCriteria: Was wrong publicly and moved on in under 5 seconds

missions.title: Playful Pressure
missions.description: Handle a genuinely stressful moment with lightness instead of intensity. Not deflection — real playfulness inside the pressure.
missions.successCriteria: Handled stress with genuine playfulness

missions.title: Abundance Riff
missions.description: List 10 alternative opportunities, paths, or options for something you're currently attached to. Prove to yourself there's always more.
missions.successCriteria: 10 alternatives listed for one attached outcome

missions.title: Embarrassment Vaccine
missions.description: Do something genuinely embarrassing in front of people you know. Not strangers — people whose opinion you actually care about.
missions.successCriteria: Genuinely embarrassing act in front of people who matter

missions.title: Full Day Ungripped
missions.description: Spend an entire day without checking outcomes, replaying conversations, or managing perception. Zero grip for 16 waking hours.
missions.successCriteria: Full waking day without outcome checking or replay

missions.title: Carefree Creation
missions.description: Create and share something without editing, polishing, or second-guessing. Raw creation → immediate share. No revision pass.
missions.successCriteria: Created and shared without any editing pass

missions.title: Walk Away Clean
missions.description: Walk away from something you're attached to and don't look back for 48 hours. No checking, no revisiting, no 'just one peek.'
missions.successCriteria: 48 hours with zero contact on something you're attached to

missions.title: High-Stakes Play
missions.description: Handle a genuinely high-stakes situation with real lightness. Not performed calm — actual playfulness when the outcome matters.
missions.successCriteria: Genuine playfulness in a high-stakes situation

missions.title: The Game Day
missions.description: Treat the highest-pressure day of your month as a game you're winning by enjoying. Full stakes, full play, zero grip.
missions.successCriteria: Highest-pressure day handled with genuine enjoyment

missions.title: Single Channel
missions.description: Do one task for 30 minutes with zero distractions. One tab, no phone, no switching. When the pull comes, notice it and stay.
missions.successCriteria: 30 minutes of single-task focus with zero distractions

missions.title: Sensory Dive
missions.description: Stop 5 times today and spend 30 seconds fully in your senses. Not thinking about senses — being in them. Hear, feel, see, taste.
missions.successCriteria: 5 sensory immersion moments of 30+ seconds

missions.title: Eyes In
missions.description: Maintain steady eye contact for an entire conversation. Notice every urge to look away and override it.
missions.successCriteria: One full conversation with steady eye contact

missions.title: Listen Empty
missions.description: In one conversation today, don't prepare your response at all while they speak. Full attention on their words. Silence after. Then respond.
missions.successCriteria: One conversation with zero response preparation while listening

missions.title: Phone Stack
missions.description: Go 2 hours without checking your phone. Not on silent in your pocket — physically away from you. Notice the phantom pulls.
missions.successCriteria: 2 hours phone-free

missions.title: Boredom Sit
missions.description: Sit for 10 minutes with zero input. No phone, no music, no book, no nothing. Just you and whatever arises. Don't follow the thoughts.
missions.successCriteria: 10 minutes of zero-input sitting

missions.title: Walking Meditation
missions.description: Take a 15-minute walk as pure presence practice. Feel your feet hit the ground, notice surroundings in detail, no audio. Be where you are.
missions.successCriteria: 15-minute presence walk with no audio

missions.title: Attention Audit
missions.description: Count how many times per hour your attention drifts without permission during a work session. Log the number. Awareness before correction.
missions.successCriteria: One hour of drift counting with logged number

missions.title: Full Weight
missions.description: Give one person your complete, undivided attention for 15 minutes. No phone glances, no thought drift, no waiting for your turn. Full weight on them.
missions.successCriteria: 15 minutes of undivided attention to one person

missions.title: Presence Day
missions.description: Spend an entire work day in single-task mode. One thing at a time. No tab switching, no multi-tasking, no splitting attention. All day.
missions.successCriteria: Full work day in single-task mode

missions.title: Environmental Read
missions.description: In one conversation, notice 5+ micro-expressions, tone shifts, or body language signals. Write them down after. See what distracted people miss.
missions.successCriteria: 5+ micro-signals noticed and logged from one conversation

missions.title: Deep Absorption
missions.description: Enter a state of total absorption in one activity for 60+ minutes. No awareness of time passing. The observer disappears.
missions.successCriteria: 60+ minutes of total absorption

missions.title: Presence Under Pressure
missions.description: Maintain full presence during a high-stakes conversation or conflict. No drift, no self-monitoring, no leaving the moment. Stay in it completely.
missions.successCriteria: Full presence maintained in a high-stakes interaction

missions.title: Stillness in Chaos
missions.description: Stay fully present in a chaotic, overstimulating environment for 30+ minutes. Noise, movement, pressure — and you're still. Fully here.
missions.successCriteria: 30+ minutes of full presence in chaotic environment

missions.title: The Flow Day
missions.description: Spend an entire day in presence with zero absence. Every conversation, every task, every moment — fully lived. The ultimate presence test.
missions.successCriteria: Full day of unbroken presence

missions.title: Zero to Ship
missions.description: Think of something, build the ugly version, and ship it today. Not plan it — ship it. Idea to reality in one day.
missions.successCriteria: One thing conceived and shipped in the same day

missions.title: The Blitz
missions.description: Execute 5 tasks in 1 hour. Each one started immediately upon thinking of it. No queue, no 'I'll do it after.' Now.
missions.successCriteria: 5 tasks executed in 1 hour

missions.title: 60-Second Decision
missions.description: Make 3 decisions today with a 60-second hard timer. Start the timer, decide, execute. No revisiting allowed.
missions.successCriteria: 3 decisions made within 60-second timers

missions.title: First to Move
missions.description: Be first to act, decide, or respond in every group context today. Nobody moves before you. You set the pace.
missions.successCriteria: First mover in all group contexts today

missions.title: Cut the Timeline
missions.description: Take your next deadline and cut it in half. Then try to beat even that. Speed is the weapon.
missions.successCriteria: Delivered before halved deadline

missions.title: Public Commit
missions.description: Tell someone what you'll do and by when. Then deliver before the deadline. Social pressure as forcing function.
missions.successCriteria: Public commitment made and delivered on time

missions.title: Prototype Hour
missions.description: Build an ugly prototype of something in under 60 minutes. Functional, not pretty. Ship the rough version, iterate later.
missions.successCriteria: Working prototype built in under 60 minutes

missions.title: Kill the Research
missions.description: Execute a task you've been researching or planning without any more research. You know enough. Move.
missions.successCriteria: Executed a task that was stuck in research/planning

missions.title: Failure Sprint
missions.description: Do 3 things that might fail today. If you have zero failures by end of day, you played too safe.
missions.successCriteria: 3 actions taken with genuine risk of failure

missions.title: Ship Every Day
missions.description: Ship something real into the world for 7 consecutive days. One thing per day, every day. The streak is the challenge.
missions.successCriteria: 7-day shipping streak

missions.title: Same Day Turnaround
missions.description: Receive a request or task and deliver it within the same day. Not started — delivered. From inbox to done in hours.
missions.successCriteria: Request received and fully delivered same day

missions.title: Decision Cascade
missions.description: Make 10 meaningful decisions in one day with no more than 5 minutes each. Stack decisions like dominoes.
missions.successCriteria: 10 meaningful decisions in one day, all under 5 minutes

missions.title: Compressed Sprint
missions.description: Deliver a week's worth of output in one day. Not through longer hours — through eliminated waste, zero friction, pure execution.
missions.successCriteria: Week's output delivered in one day

missions.title: Act Then Align
missions.description: Take initiative on something important. Act first, align the team after. Momentum over consensus. Speed over alignment.
missions.successCriteria: Initiative taken first, alignment done after

missions.title: The Impossible Sprint
missions.description: Deliver something in 24 hours that should take a week, at a quality that makes people ask how. The ultimate bias-to-action move.
missions.successCriteria: Delivered week-level output in 24 hours at undeniable quality
